answers.answer: Hi,There are many causes of numbness and tingling other than Diabetes. Some of them are- pressure on spinal nerves e.g. from a herniated disk, pressure on peripheral nerves from tumours, enlarged blood vessels,  scar or infection, Herpes zoster infection, Multiple sclerosis, underactive thyroid, Raynaud’s phenomenon, electrolyte imbalance, vitamin B12 deficiency; or toxic nerve damage due to lead, alcohol or tobacco. Please consult a neurologist and go for MRI of spine and extremities, and nerve conduction studies to know the cause of the symptoms. Hope this helps you. Take care and regards!

question: I have had numbness in my hands and have an appointment for testing for carbell tunnel but now my feet are numb so i believe it is something else.  I have had my sugar tested and it is in normal rangeThis discussion is related to/posts/show/893866.
title: numb hands and feet
